availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, carpenter. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Hamilton Remington in Harrison County, Kentucky on February 9, 1826. Father of Louise Remington, Benjamin F. Remington, Elizabeth H. Remington, and Caroline S. Remington. Married to Elizabeth A. Remington. Father of Mary A. Remington, Sarah Remington, Eliza Remington, James A. Remington, and Greenup Remington. Resident of Harrison County in 1830. Owned one enslaved person in Harrison County in 1830. Resident of Harrison County in 1840. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1840. Carpenter in Harrison County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Resident of Harrison County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860. Household owned an additional ten enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.
